intro: Uruparia homomalla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed uruparia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks and in forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Uruparia homomalla produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
